name: Reference Pointer
description: The RP data type is used to reference external documents, files, or data objects that are related to but not contained within the HL7 message. It provides a structured way to point to multimedia content, external reports, images, documents, or other data that supplements the information in the message. RP enables linking to various types of external resources while maintaining the integrity and relationships of healthcare information.

RP.1.name: Pointer
RP.1.description: The actual pointer or reference to the external resource. This may be a file path, URL, database key, or other identifier that can be used to locate the referenced content.

RP.2.name: Application ID
RP.2.description: Identifies the application or system that manages or owns the referenced resource. Hierarchic designator for the system that can provide access to the referenced content.

RP.3.name: Type of Data
RP.3.description: Specifies the type or format of the referenced data (e.g., image, document, audio, video). Indicates what kind of content the pointer references.

RP.4.name: Subtype
RP.4.description: Further specifies the subtype or specific format of the referenced data (e.g., JPEG, PDF, DICOM). Provides more detailed type information.

constraints.pointerRequired: RP.1 (Pointer) should typically be populated for meaningful reference
constraints.typeConsistency: Type of Data should match the actual format of the referenced content
constraints.accessibility: Referenced resources should be accessible to authorized systems and users
